node.title: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to Amazon, HBO, Hulu and More in December
node.alt: Temuera Morrison and Ming-Na Wen in “The Book of Boba Fett.”
node.description: Every month, streaming services add movies and TV shows to its library. Here are our picks for some of December’s most promising new titles.
node.content: ["(Note: Streaming services occasionally change schedules without giving notice. For more recommendations on what to stream, sign up for our Watching newsletter here.)", "\u2018The Rescue\u2019", "Starts streaming: Dec. 3", "In \u201cThe Rescue,\u201d the documentary filmmaking team of Elizabeth Chai Vasarhelyi and Jimmy Chin \u2014 who won an Oscar for their film \u201cFree Solo\u201d \u2014 tell the stories of the skilled divers who worked to save a dozen young Thai soccer players trapped in a flooded Tham Luang Nang Non cave in the summer of 2018. The rescue operation drew volunteers from around the world and was covered in-depth by the broadcast and print media. Vasarhelyi and Chin incorporate some of that coverage into \u201cThe Rescue,\u201d alongside new interviews with the rescue team, for a fuller view into what happened. But their primary focus is on what the divers experienced as they tried to puzzle out how to navigate through underground passages and how to extract survivors. The P.O.V. footage the divers shot themselves is often harrowing, capturing the claustrophobic pressure and the sense of panic that sets in when the waters rise.", "\u2018The Book of Boba Fett\u2019", "Starts streaming: Dec. 29", "There are no new \u201cThe Mandalorian\u201d episodes until 2022, so fans of the \u201cStar Wars\u201d universe\u2019s bounty-hunter subculture will have to rely on this spinoff series to tide them over. Temuera Morrison reprises his role as Boba Fett, a storied mercenary who, alongside his colleague Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen), comes out of hiding and attempts to reestablish himself as someone to be feared and respected in the criminal underworld. A lot of the \u201cMandalorian\u201d creative team also worked on \u201cThe Book of Boba Fett,\u201d as did some of the supporting cast. This promises to be another action-packed throwback adventure series, exploring the difficult lives and the complicated ethical codes of characters whose jobs demand danger and violence.", "Also arriving:", "Dec. 3", "\u201cDiary of a Wimpy Kid\u201d", "Dec. 8", "\u201cWelcome to Earth\u201d", "Dec. 15", "\u201cFoodtastic,\u201d Season 1", "Dec. 17", "\u201cArendelle Castle Yule Log: Cut Paper Edition\u201d", "\u2018It\u2019s Always Sunny in Philadelphia,\u2019 Season 15", "Starts streaming: Dec. 2", "The longest-running sitcom in television history returns for a new season. As usual, it will combine the show\u2019s lowlife high jinks with some episodes that directly engage with what\u2019s going on in the world today. For example, the season\u2019s first episode is about how the gang at Paddy\u2019s Pub \u2014 Mac, Charlie, Dennis, Dee and Frank \u2014 try to make money off the pandemic. And episode two comments on the sometimes reckless political incorrectness of some older \u201cIt\u2019s Always Sunny in Philadelphia\u201d jokes. The series continues on from there, filtering reality through the skewed perspective of characters who hardly every change, even as society keeps shifting all around them.", "Also arriving:", "Dec. 1", "\u201cCandified: Home for the Holidays,\u201d Season 1", "Dec. 2", "\u201cGodfather of Harlem,\u201d Season 1", "Dec. 3", "\u201cThe New York Times Presents: To Live and Die in Alabama\u201d", "\u201cPEN15,\u201d Season 2, Part 2", "\u201cTrolls: Holiday in Harmony\u201d", "Dec. 9", "\u201cBloods,\u201d Season 1", "\u201cCreamerie,\u201d Season 1", "\u201cSwan Song\u201d", "Dec. 10", "\u201cCrossing Swords,\u201d Season 2", "Dec. 16", "\u201cDead Asleep\u201d", "Dec. 17", "\u201cMother/Android\u201d", "Dec. 23", "\u201cDragons: The Nine Realms\u201d Season 1", "Dec. 26", "\u201cLetterkenny\u201d Season 10", "\u2018Being the Ricardos\u2019", "Starts streaming: Dec. 21", "The writer-director Aaron Sorkin follows up his American history lesson \u201cThe Trial of the Chicago 7\u201d with another look back into our cultural past, this time exploring the world of television in its infancy as a mass medium. In \u201cBeing the Ricardos,\u201d Nicole Kidman plays Lucille Ball and Javier Bardem plays Desi Arnaz during one week of production on the groundbreaking 1950s sitcom \u201cI Love Lucy.\u201d The setup frames a larger study of the celebrity couple\u2019s tumultuous romantic, creative and business partnership. Expect to hear plenty of Sorkin\u2019s rapid-fire dialogue, applied to a backstage melodrama with echoes of his TV series \u201cSports Night\u201d and \u201cStudio 60 on the Sunset Strip.\u201d", "Also arriving:", "Dec. 3", "\u201cHarlem\u201d", "Dec. 9", "\u201cThe Ferragnez\u201d", "Dec. 10", "\u201cEncounter\u201d", "\u201cThe Expanse,\u201d Season 6", "Dec. 17", "\u201cWith Love\u201d", "Dec. 23", "\u201cYearly Departed\u201d", "\u201cListening to Kenny G\u201d", "Starts streaming: Dec. 2", "The \u201cMusic Box\u201d docuseries debuts three new films on HBO this month, including \u201cMr. Saturday Night\u201d (about the swaggering industry impresario Robert Stigwood) and \u201cJuice WRLD: Into the Abyss\u201d (about the rapper\u2019s short life and influential career). But the movie likely to draw the most attention is Penny Lane\u2019s slyly provocative \u201cListening to Kenny G.\u201d This comprehensive biography of the wildly successful and deeply divisive pop-jazz saxophonist Kenneth Gorelick \u2014 made with his full participation \u2014 doubles as a sincere consideration of why some people love Kenny G\u2019s music and why some think it is pandering schmaltz. Gorelick is a disarming interview subject, willing to defend himself but seemingly unconcerned about his critical reputation. It\u2019s the critics featured in the documentary that add the most, as they wrestle honestly with the long-term effects \u2014 positive and negative \u2014 of middle-of-the-road popular music.", "Also arriving:", "Dec. 1", "\u201cAdrienne\u201d", "Dec. 2", "\u201cPerfect Life\u201d", "\u201cSanta Inc\u201d", "Dec. 5", "\u201cBeforeigners\u201d", "Dec. 6", "\u201cLandscapers\u201d", "Dec. 7", "\u201cThe Slow Hustle\u201d", "Dec. 9", "\u201cAnd Just Like That \u2026\u201d", "\u201cMr. Saturday Night\u201d", "Dec. 13", "\u201cStreet Gang: How We Got to Sesame Street\u201d", "Dec. 16", "\u201cFinding Magic Mike\u201d", "\u201cJuice WRLD: Into the Abyss\u201d", "\u201cStation Eleven\u201d", "Dec. 22", "\u201cThe Matrix Resurrections\u201d", "\u201c1883\u201d", "Starts streaming: Dec. 19", "Given that the modern western drama \u201cYellowstone\u201d is one of the most-watched series on cable and streaming right now, it was probably inevitable that Paramount and the show\u2019s creator, Taylor Sheridan, would try to expand the franchise. Sheridan \u2014 an accomplished writer, director and producer whose credits include the likes of \u201cSicario\u201d and \u201cHell or High Water\u201d \u2014 ventures back to the late 19th century to follow a grizzled adventurer (played by Sam Elliott) as he helps a pioneer couple (played by Tim McGraw and Faith Hill) find their way to Montana. There, they\u2019ll establish the Dutton ranch that is the main setting of \u201cYellowstone\u201d \u2014 though not without plenty of the obstacles and soul-searching that make the parent show so compelling.", "Also arriving:", "Dec. 2", "\u201cQueen of the Universe\u201d", "Dec. 23", "\u201cReno 911: The Hunt for QAnon\u201d", "\u201cBaking It\u201d", "Starts streaming: Dec. 2", "The team behind the heartwarming reality competition show \u201cMaking It\u201d offers as unique twist on the bake-off, in a series in which two-person teams cook in a homey kitchen and try to impress a judging panel of four opinionated grandmas. Maya Rudolph and Andy Samberg are the \u201cBaking It\u201d hosts, serving up playful banter and earnest support as contestants produce creative and delicious treats. The drama level is kept purposefully low, leaving room for lots of good holiday vibes.", "\u201cMacGruber\u201d", "Starts streaming: Dec. 16", "The comedian Will Forte and the \u201cSaturday Night Live\u201d writer-directors Jorma Taccone and John Solomon introduced the resourceful but easily distracted special agent MacGruber (played by Forte) in a series of \u201cSNL\u201d sketches that began in 2007. They spun the character off into a strange 2010 movie that has a fiercely devoted cult of fans; now they\u2019re bringing MacGruber back to TV as a serialized action-adventure spoof, with the hero returning to work after a decade in prison. Kristen Wiig comes back as the superspy\u2019s sidekick, for straight-faced, absurdist riffs on over-the-top \u201980s and \u201990s international thrillers.", "Also arriving:", "Dec. 4", "\u201cSiwas Dance Pop Revolution\u201d", "Dec. 9", "\u201cThe Housewives of the North Pole\u201d", "Dec. 23", "\u201cVigil\u201d"]
